# Draft:Howard Yang

Howard Yang (, born November 1957) is a Chinese engineer, entrepreneur, and executive. He is the chairman, chief executive officer, and chief scientist of Montage Technology (澜起科技股份有限公司).
Early life and education
Howard Yang was born in November 1957 and is of Han Chinese ethnicity. He earned his Master’s and PhD degrees in Electrical and Computer Engineering from Oregon State University in the United States.
Career
From 1990 to 1994, Yang worked in chip design and research at companies including National Semiconductor in the United States. He then served as head of the New Product Development Department at Shanghai Belling from 1994 to 1996. In 1997, he co-founded NewWave Technology, which merged with Integrated Device Technology (IDT) in 2001.
In 2004, Yang co-founded Montage Technology with Stephen Kuong-Io Tai, taking the roles of chairman, CEO, and chief scientist. At Montage, he led the development and commercialization of low-power DDR memory buffer controller chips. He has also been active in academic and teaching initiatives at Shanghai Jiao Tong University, serving as a PhD advisor under the Zhiyuan Honor Program.
Research and contributions
Yang has published extensively in communications, hard disk drives, phase-locked loops, operational amplifiers, low-noise logic, and gallium arsenide devices and circuits. He is internationally recognized for proposing the operational amplifier "minimum settling time" theory and calculation method, which is widely adopted in both academia and industry.
Awards and honors
* 2010: Elected IEEE Fellow
* 2012–present: China Electronics Society Science and Technology Award (First Class)
* Shanghai Municipal Science and Technology Award (First Class)
* IEEE CAS Industrial Pioneer Award
* JEDEC Outstanding Management Leadership Award (2020)
* White Magnolia Award from Shanghai Municipal Government
* 2022: IEEE Life Fellow
* 2025: Forbes China Best CEO list
